Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2009 08:41PM nikkidonahue wrote: Thank you!  Yes my Mom i\will be taking care of me for 2 weeks and hubby can take off after that if necessary.  Alsp have a great church family who will bring meals and such.  I have never had surgery before so I am a little nervous!
Posts.Title: First post - Surgery December 1 nikkidonahue nikkidonahue

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2009 11:24PM nikkidonahue wrote: Well I am improving a little bit each day.  The kids and I go back home tomorrow.  I am a little stressed about it, as I still can't lift the baby and I have so much to do at home - my house is a disaster!  I do have some help coming but it's still overwhelming.  Sometimes I feel like I'm recovering fast and then other times I feel like it's going slow.  I guess there is a huge range of normal.
Posts.Title: First post - Surgery December 1 nikkidonahue nikkidonahue

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2009 03:16PM nikkidonahue wrote: Hi, just wanted to send out a huge THANK YOU for all your prayers.  My surgery went well yesterday and I did get some sleep last night in between nurses visiting me all through the night!  I am sitting in a chair with my laptop right now, so that should give you an idea of how I'm feeling.  I will update more later - God is awesome and showed His presence yesterday in some neat ways, which I will share later.
Posts.Title: First post - Surgery December 1 nikkidonahue nikkidonahue

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2009 06:04PM nikkidonahue wrote: Thank you all so much for your kind words.  God is awesome and He WILL carry me through.  I will update when I can.  Hubby and I are going out for a late dinner and he just got home.  THANKS AGAIN!!!
Posts.Title: First post - Surgery December 1 nikkidonahue nikkidonahue

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2009 08:29PM nikkidonahue wrote: Sorry it took me so long to update.  I stayed in the hospital 2 extra nights because my thyroid was hyper and it was affecting my heartbeat.  The positive side of staying 5 days was that I came home with no drains!  I was so happy to have those out, but amazed that they were ready to so quickly.  The most pain I am having is in my back and shoulders, I guess from the reduced movement and sleeping in one position on my back for so many days.  My care coordinator also mentioned that having my port removed during my surgery is the cause of the more prominent pain on my left shoulder, which I thought was strange, but then I remembered how sore my whole arm and shoulder were when the port was "installed" and it makes sense, I guess.  My Mom is taking great care of me and my kids.  I am doing fairly well, getting around and doing a few things but not too many.  If you'd like to read more about my hospital experience, you can check my Caring Bridge page at www.caringbridge.org/visit/nikkidonahue.  Thank you for all your support!
Posts.Title: First post - Surgery December 1 nikkidonahue nikkidonahue
